intro: Seseli cantabricum, commonly known as the Cantabrian seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in mountainous regions. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
